Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2009 03:02PM gmw wrote: Kristi: My name is Gina.  I will find out tomorrow 4/22 the results of my 'onco-type' and whether or not I will need chemo and if so what type.  My oncologist gave me the impression that I will have it and probably start by the end of April or Early May.  He said I will probably be getting 'taxotere' in combination with another drug that starts with a 'c'. I was diagnosed on 3/6/09 and had a lumpectomy on 3/12/09. I am 52 with 3 grown children and 3 precious grandbabies. I don't have a family history, this was really a shock.  I have gotten mammos. since I was 40.  This was the first time they found anything abnormal. 7 lymph nodes were removed and were negative, praise God!  I was hoping that because they caught it early, I wouldn't have to deal with chemo, however, as I am learning, they are much more agressive with treatments to prevent recurrence than in the past. It has been scarey at times, but my faith has really been my anchor.  I hope things go well for you.  I wonder if it is 100% that we all loose our hair? God bless you - Gina
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2009 04:05PM gmw wrote: Hi Kristi: I find out tomorrow 4/21 if I will be starting Chemo.  My oncologist had me get several tests including an 'onco-type'.  He has all the results and will go over them with me tomorrow.  He indicated on our first visit that I would be getting taxotere in combination with another drug that starts with a 'C'.  He also said to expect 4 treatments that were 3 weeks apart.  Sounds similar to you. I have cut my hair short, but wonder if it is 'for sure' that I will loose my hair?  Any thoughts?   Ready or not, here we come! God bless you - Gina
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2009 04:18PM gmw wrote: I am right there with you.  I was diagnosed 3/6/09, had a lumpectomy 3/12/09.  Now I am waiting to see if chemo is needed.  If so, I will start chemo, then radiation along with hormone therapy.  Hang in there and ask God to help you.  He has been my anchor and is with me every minute, even my best friend, my husband, can't be with me all the time!  He will help you make decisions and give you peac. God bless you - gmw
